description: Rep. Madeleine Dean (D-PA) states it's a great day for the American public after the House passes Obamacare extensions and that the American people were heard. She also shares her thoughts on whether or not the House will take up the War Powers Bill and her reaction to the President after last weekend's actions in Venezuela. Representative Dean speaks with Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Americans Were Heard: Rep. Dean on ACA Extension

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan is set to report a record annual trade surplus with the US, a figure that complicates the two sides’ drawn-out tariff negotiations.
title: Taiwan’s US Trade Surplus Set for Record as Negotiations Drag On

description: Cambodian Deputy Prime Minister Sun Chanthol wants to “lower the temperature” in a border dispute with Thailand to protect a fragile ceasefire and pushed on Bangkok’s assertions that the clash was a battle against scam centers. Sun Chanthol spoke in an exclusive interview with Bloomberg reporter Philip Heijmans in Phnom Penh on the ongoing discussions with Thailand, the arrest of scam kingpin Chen Zhi, and the impact of US tariffs on the economy. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Cambodia Deputy PM Pushes to Cool Thai Border Tensions

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukraine reported explosions across the country as Russia launched a widespread air attack, targeting energy infrastructure and damaging apartment buildings.
title: Ukraine Says Russia Launched Another Large Round of Airstrikes

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Cambodia’s Deputy Prime Minister Sun Chanthol said his country wants to “lower the temperature” in its dispute with Thailand to protect a fragile ceasefire and pushed back against Bangkok’s assertions that the clash was a battle against scam centers operating over the border.
title: Cambodia Pushes Back on Thai Scam Strikes, Seeks to Cool Border

description: Rep. Nick LaLota (R-NY) shares his reaction to Obamacare extensions passing in the House and what he expects the Senate to do next. He also talks about how his vote in favor of the extensions aligns with what President Trump spoke to GOP congress members about, and he discusses why he doesn’t think the government will shutdown at the end of the month. Representative LaLota speaks with Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg’s “Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Need Some Compromise: Rep. LaLota on ACA Extension

author: Daniel Flatley
description: A bipartisan pair of lawmakers is asking Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent to conduct a national security review of a proposal that would hand control of Roomba vacuum manufacturer iRobot Corp. to its main Chinese supplier as part of a bankruptcy case.
title: Lawmakers Seek Scrutiny of China Ownership in iRobot Bankruptcy

author: Aashna Shah
description: New Jersey Transit’s Chief Executive Officer Kris Kolluri will keep his role under the state’s soon-to-be Governor Mikie Sherrill, while poised to take on a second position overseeing two of the state’s major toll roads.
title: NJ Transit CEO Kolluri Stays Under Sherrill, Adds Turnpike Role

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Josh Wingrove, Courtney Subramanian, Kevin Crowley, Mia Gindis
description: Energy bosses see long haul ahead, but worry they’ll get railroaded into promising a quick fix
title: Trump’s Team Orders Big Oil Into Venezuela: ‘Do It for Our Country’

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: Meta Platforms Inc. has hired the former top lawyer for Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency as a lobbyist, according to previously unreported government filings.
title: Meta Hires Former DOGE, Trump Election Lawyer as Lobbyist

description: On today’s Big Take podcast, Sanne Wass and Joe Deaux unpack escalating White House rhetoric around Greenland — and the existential questions it raises for NATO — in the wake of US military action in Venezuela. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US action in Venezuela is worrying Greenland, Denmark and NATO

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: It’s the first sign of movement, but the Senate is yet to weigh in.
title: Obamacare Subsidies Get a Burst of Momentum With House Vote

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: A band of House Republicans bucked party leaders to join Democrats in passing a measure to restore expired Obamacare subsidies through the end of President Donald Trump’s term, as rising health care costs drive midterm election anxieties.
title: House Votes to Renew Obamacare Subsidies in Blow to GOP Leaders

description: With President Nicolás Maduro deposed, President Donald Trump wants US oil giants to revive Venezuela’s energy industry. Though it’s unclear who, if anyone, will take part, Chevron is already there. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Why One Oil Company Has a Head Start in Venezuela

author: Catherine Lucey, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US President Donald Trump said he was directing the purchase of $200 billion in mortgage bonds, which he cast as his latest effort to bring down housing costs ahead of the November midterm election.
title: Trump Directs $200 Billion Mortgage Bond Buy in Housing Push

description:
On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss the latest on the Minneapolis ICE shooting with Bloomberg's Alicia Caldwell. Then, Bloomberg's Stuart Paul and Alli McCartney of UBS Alignment Partners count down to Friday's payrolls report as traders await data catalysts amid an equity rotation.
Also, Bloomberg Tech Co-host Ed Ludlow recaps CES 2026, and Conor Sen of Bloomberg Opinion and Peachtree Creek Investments weighs in on home affordability as President Trump looks to ban corporate homebuying. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Traders Await Payrolls as Rotation Hits Big Tech | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 1/08/2026

description: Bloomberg's George Ferguson breaks down the market reaction to President Trump's calls for a $1.5 trillion dollar defense budget, as well as his threat to cut some of the most notable names in defense technology at the same time.  The president took to Truth Social to single out RTX, writing that the defense contractor would no longer be doing business with the government unless it stepped up upfront spending. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Demands Increase in Defense Spending

author: Lucy White, Alex Wickham
description: The UK’s Ministry of Defence is short £28 billion ($38 billion) over the next four years despite vows to boost spending on the department, Britain’s most senior military chief has warned Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: Starmer Warned That UK’s Military Faces £28 Billion Shortfall

description: Carol Massar and Tim Stenovic speak to Conor Sen of Bloomberg Opinion and Peachtree Creek Investments weighs in on home affordability as President Trump looks to ban corporate homebuying. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Targets Institutional Investors in Affordable Push

description: Carol Massar and Tim Stenovic speak with Bloomberg's Stuart Paul and Alli McCartney of UBS Alignment Partners count down to Friday's payrolls report as traders await data catalysts amid an equity rotation. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Count Down to Friday's Payrolls Report

description: Bloomberg's Jamie Tarabay dives deep on the military operation to capture Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro, breaking down the play by play of the raid, as well as the tech and cyber capabilities used by the US military during the mission. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Inside the Nighttime Raid to Capture Venezuela's Maduro

description: Democrat Representative from Washington Suzan DelBene, who also serves as the chair of the DCCC, says that the vote on an extension of ACA subsidies in the house is an 'important step forward' to push the Senate to make a deal on health care, even if this bill never becomes law. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Hope For Health Care Bills to Continue on 'Bipartisan Path,' Says DelBene

author: Greg Ryan
description: Massachusetts is dipping into its reserves for $250 million as a way to help cover the hole in health insurance coverage created by the expiration of federal Obamacare subsidies.
title: Massachusetts Gives $250 Million to Cover Rising Insurance Costs

author: Alicia Diaz
description: The Republican-controlled House voted to sustain Donald Trump’s vetoes of two pieces of legislation despite concerns among some lawmakers from both parties that the president’s actions amounted to acts of retribution.
title: Trump Vetoes Survive Challenge Despite GOP Retribution Concerns

author: Henrique Almeida
description: Portugal’s former central-bank Governor Mario Centeno said he is running for the role of European Central Bank vice president.
title: Portugal’s Centeno Says He’s Running for ECB Vice President Role

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondents Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall discuss several votes on Capitol Hill. On today's show, House Ways and Means Committee Chairman Jason Smith, Bully Pulpit International Managing Director Adam Hodge, Firehouse Strategies Managing Partner Adam Terrill and Democratic Congresswoman Suzan DelBene of Washington. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Senate Rebukes Trip on Venezuela | Balance of Power: Early Edition 1/08/2026

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said President Donald Trump’s proposal to keep large firms from buying up single-family homes in the US would be forward-looking and not result in a forced sale of current holdings.
title: Bessent Says Private Equity Firms Won’t Be Forced to Sell Homes

description: House Ways and Means Committee Chair Jason Smith said the status quo on healthcare costs is unacceptable but extending Obamacare subsidies for a small portion of the population won't address the issue. The Missouri Congressman also said that President Trump's call to raise the defense budget by half a trillion dollars is an example of Trump 'investing in law and order.' (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Rep. Smith Says Health Care Status Quo 'Unacceptable' But Obamacare Not the Answer

description: Vice President JD Vance says the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agent who shot and killed a driver in Minneapolis was defending himself. Vance says the mainstream media has been unfairly covering the story. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Vance Says ICE Agent Defended Himself in Shooting

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The Trump administration will create a new assistant attorney general position to lead fraud investigations, Vice President JD Vance said, as the White House looks to highlight instances of social services fraud in Democrat-run states.
title: Vance Says New Anti-Fraud Prosecutor Will Report to White House, Not DOJ

description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul and New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani announced a new investment to provide free child care for all two-year-old children in New York City. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Mamdani, Hochul Launch Free Child Care Program for Two-Year-Olds

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: It took Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva hours to issue his first reaction to the US military operation that captured Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro on Saturday. When he weighed in, Brazil’s president struck a careful tone.
title: Lula Plays It Safe on Maduro as Reelection Fight Looms

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, David Wethe
description: More than a dozen oil executives — including veteran wildcatter Harold Hamm — are slated to meet with President Donald Trump and top officials at the White House Friday, as the administration pushes them to rebuild Venezuela’s battered energy sector.
title: Trump Venezuela Meeting Is Shaping as Who’s Who of US Oil

author: Gerry Doyle, Matt Turner
description: The biggest US defense companies spent twice as much on stock buybacks and dividends than they did on capital expenditures the past five years, a mismatch that has drawn the ire of President Donald Trump as he demands a reversal.
title: US Defense Majors Face a $110 Billion Conundrum to Please Trump

author: Oscar Medina, Matthew Bristow
description: Colombia is seeking to be taken off Washington’s list of rogue drug-trafficking nations as relations thaw between Presidents Donald Trump and Gustavo Petro.
title: Colombia to Lobby Trump to Exit US List of Rogue Drug Nations

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Kate Sullivan, Saleha Mohsin, Nancy Cook
description: The White House excluded Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard from months of planning to oust Nicolas Maduro because her previous opposition to military action in Venezuela cast doubt on her willingness to support the operation, people familiar with the matter said.
title: US Spy Chief Gabbard Excluded From Maduro Plan Over Past Views

description: Tensions are high in Minneapolis after the fatal shooting of a driver by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent on Jan. 7. Anti-ICE protests have broken out all over the area. The Minneapolis public school system canceled classes for the rest of the week. This is video from outside a federal building in St. Paul. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Minneapolis Cancels Classes as Anti-ICE Protests Raise Tensions

description:
White House trade advisor Peter Navarro says US innovation will end China's "weaponization" of rare earths.

He told Mishal Husain that in the meantime, Donald Trump must negotiate with Xi Jinping and other "vicious dictators."

Subscribe to The Mishal Husain Show wherever you get your podcasts. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Navarro Sees US Ending China’s Grip on Rare Earths

author: Fabiola Zerpa, Andreina Itriago
description: Venezuela’s government plans to free an “important number” of local and foreign prisoners after the US capture of President Nicolás Maduro.
title: Venezuela Vows to Release Prisoners After US Captures Maduro

description:
Ian Bremmer of Eurasia Group says the United States is undoing its own global order and is
"in the midst of what we call a political revolution." He talks President Donald Trump's challenges with Venezuela, Russia, Ukraine, China, a global trade war and upcoming midterm elections. He speaks to Bloomberg's Francine Lacqua.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Is Undoing the Global World Order, Bremmer Says

author: Courtney Subramanian, Mishal Husain
description: US President Donald Trump’s White House trade adviser predicted American industrial breakthroughs would help boost domestic production and eliminate China’s market dominance of rare earths.
title: Navarro Sees US Ending Chinese Dominance of Critical Minerals

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The Senate dealt a rare rebuke to President Donald Trump in a Thursday vote to advance legislation opposing further military action in Venezuela, demonstrating formidable political opposition to a foreign intervention that has yet to cost the life of a single US service member.
title: Senate Rebukes Trump on Venezuela, Seeks to End Military Action

description: A US attack against Denmark over Greenland would end NATO as we know it, says Nicholas Burns, the former US ambassador to China. Burns says no military action has to happen for President Donald Trump to get what he wants. Burns speaks on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: A US Attack on Greenland Is 'Unthinkable,' Burns Says

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: President-elect José Antonio Kast told Chilean business leaders he’ll announce his long-awaited cabinet on Jan. 20 as he doubled down on his pro-market plans to spur economic growth and cut red tape.
title: Kast Tells Investors He’ll Name Chile’s New Cabinet on Jan. 20

author: Alex Morales
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s governing Labour Party slipped behind the main opposition Conservative Party in Bloomberg’s composite poll for the first time since the July 2024 general election.
title: Labour Slips Behind Tories for First Time Since UK Election

author: Alex Wickham
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer vowed action and demanded Elon Musk’s X urgently “get their act together” over sexualized images of children produced by its artificial intelligence tool Grok.
title: UK’s Starmer Threatens Musk’s X With Action Over Child Images

author: Sam Dagher, Fiona MacDonald
description: Saudi Arabia is moving to end the role of the United Arab Emirates in Yemen and diminish its neighbor’s influence in other arenas, including the Red Sea, as tensions rise in the longstanding rivalry between the two Gulf powerhouses.
title: Saudi Arabia Moves to Rein In UAE After Yemen Exposes Rivalry

author: Franco Dantas
description: Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva vetoed a bill that sought to reduce the prison term of Jair Bolsonaro, the former president who is serving a 27-year sentence for plotting a coup following his 2022 election defeat.
title: Lula Vetoes Bill That Sought to Reduce Bolsonaro Prison Sentence

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: The Minneapolis public school system canceled classes for the rest of the week in the aftermath of a deadly shooting by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer, as protests featuring tense standoffs with federal agents flared up again Thursday morning.
title: Minneapolis Cancels School as Killing Inflames Anti-ICE Protests

author: Ania Nussbaum, Samy Adghirni
description: French President Emmanuel Macron accused Washington of breaching international law and turning away from its partners days after the US captured and removed Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and threatened to take control of Greenland.
title: French President Macron Slams US for Breaching International Law

description: US labor productivity accelerated in the third quarter to its strongest pace in two years. Productivity soared to an annualized rate of 4.9%. Economic growth in the quarter also powered ahead. The US trade gap narrowed in October and jobless claims rose by 8,000 to 208,000 in the week ending January 3. Bloomberg's Michael McKee wraps up all the data.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Productivity Accelerates to Strongest Pace in Two Years

author: Greg Sullivan
description: Russia exchanged jailed French citizen Laurent Vinatier for a basketball player detained in France, Tass reported, weeks after President Vladimir Putin was asked about his case during a marathon news conference and call-in show.
title: Russia Swaps French Citizen for Basketball Player, Tass Says

author: Chris Anstey
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent called for the Federal Reserve to continue cutting interest rates, extending his pressure campaign on US monetary policymakers.
title: Bessent Says Fed Shouldn’t Delay Interest-Rate Cuts, CNBC Says

author: Erik Wasson, Alicia Diaz
description: President Donald Trump’s iron grip on the House GOP will be tested Thursday in a series of votes focusing on health care, government spending and an attempt to override vetoes he issued late last month.
title: Trump’s Grip on House Republicans Faces Test in Thursday Votes

author: Alex Longley
description: An oil tanker with links to Russia was hit by a drone in the Black Sea, Turkish media reported.
title: Russia-Linked Oil Tanker Attacked in the Black Sea, NTV Says

author: Joe Mayes
description: The UK government is planning to announce a support package for pubs in the coming days, after a backlash from the sector over higher tax bills.
title: UK Plans to Announce Pubs Support Package After Tax Backlash

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Russia’s latest strikes on Ukraine’s energy facilities have left hundreds of thousands without power and heating during a cold winter, as Kyiv and Washington continue to negotiate a framework for peace.
title: Russia Strikes Ukraine’s Power Sector as Allies Draft Peace Plan

description: US President Donald Trump has said the US should take over Greenland, citing defense needs, and White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt has refused to rule out the use of military force to acquire it. The comments have sparked a reaction in Denmark and among Greenlanders, with some viewing Trump's plans as a potential opportunity for Greenland to break free from Denmark's control, while others are strongly opposed to the idea. Christian Keldsen is the CEO of the Business association in Greenland and joined Stephen Carroll and Caroline Hepker on Bloomberg Radio to discuss the impact of recent events (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Greenland Business Association CEO On 'Hostile Takeover' Fears

author: Alex Wickham, Ellen Milligan, Joe Mayes
description: The UK government has asked ministers to find reductions in their departmental spending in order to fund a controversial new digital ID program.
title: UK Government Asks Departments to Make Savings to Fund ID Plan

author: Lisa Pham
description: President Donald Trump’s plans to request an increase in the US military budget is giving a fresh boost to defense stocks around the world, with those in Europe having a particularly strong start to a year that looks set to be dominated by geopolitics.
title: Defense Stocks Soar Again as Trump Plans Military Budget Boost

author: Laura Nahmias
description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul and New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani announced a new investment to provide free child care for all two-year-old children in New York City, fulfilling part of Mamdani’s campaign pitch to offer universal care for children between the ages of six weeks and five years old.
title: Mamdani and Hochul Pitch Free Childcare for Two-Year-Olds

author: Philip Heijmans
description: A US delegation will visit Cambodia in the coming days to help fortify a fragile ceasefire with Thailand, the Southeast Asian nation’s top diplomat said.
title: Cambodia Says US Officials Set to Visit and Help Ceasefire Talks

author: Ekow Dontoh
description: A former Ghanaian finance minister who faces corruption charges in the West African nation has been detained in the US for overstaying his visa.
title: Ghana’s Ex-Finance Minister Detained in US for Overstaying Visa

author: Paul Vecchiatto, Michael Cohen
description: Warships from some members of the BRICS group of developing nations gathered in Cape Town waters for a naval exercise that places host South Africa at risk of renewed US ire.
title: South Africa Hosts Brics Naval Exercise, Risks Renewed US Ire

author: Ari Altstedter
description: A woman from Vietnam said she wanted to come to Canada to develop and sell wearable sensors for weightlifters. Her chosen path: apply for a special visa reserved for startup founders.
title: Cash-for-Visa Allegations Complicate Canada’s Race for Global Talent

author: Stephen Wicary
description: The removal of Venezuela’s president deprived the island of a key benefactor, yet Cuba’s communist regime has been nothing if not dogged over the years.
title: Toppling Cuba Would Be an Added Prize for Donald Trump

author: Sanne Wass
description: Greenland’s business community is split on the impact of Donald Trump’s renewed interest in the Arctic island.
title: Trump’s Greenland Talk Brings Opportunity, Unease for Business

description: Eldur Olafsson, founder and chief executive officer of Amaroq Ltd., says Greenland needs investment and that US interest is having a positive impact on his business. Toronto-based Amaroq operates a newly opened gold mine in Greenland and holds the largest portfolio of mineral exploration licenses in the territory. Olafsson speaks on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Greenland Needs More Investment, Amaroq CEO Says

author: Sanne Wass
description: The Arctic island territory wants to be independent, not a US satellite. Trump’s rhetoric is making everything more complicated.
title: Greenlanders Are Stuck Between Trump and an Uncomfortable Present

author: Isabel Gottlieb
description: US President Donald Trump could find out as soon as Jan. 9 whether the Supreme Court will strike down a key portion of his tariffs campaign. The court is considering whether Trump can use an emergency law that had previously never been wielded to impose import taxes, and its decision could be included in an upcoming opinions release on unspecified cases.
title: Here Are Trump’s Options If the Supreme Court Says His Tariffs Are Illegal

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysia’s Attorney General’s Chambers said it would take no further action against Deputy Prime Minister Ahmad Zahid Hamidi in relation to his graft case, citing insufficient evidence to prosecute him.
title: Malaysia Closes DPM’s Graft Case Ahead of Key Party Meeting

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Michael Nienaber
description: Germany and India are hammering out the details of a submarine manufacturing deal worth at least $8 billion — the largest-ever defense agreement for New Delhi, according to officials with direct knowledge of the details.
title: Germany and India on Verge of $8 Billion Submarine Agreement

author: Robert Tuttle, Sarah Chen, Yongchang Chin
description: China’s refiners, all but cut off from Venezuelan crude in the past week as the US positions itself for access to the world’s largest oil reserves, are eying a pricier alternative source — Canada.
title: Trump’s Venezuela Oil Grab Is Pushing Chinese Refiners to Canada

author: Nayla Razzouk, William Horobin
description: French farmers drove dozens of tractors to the Eiffel Tower and other Parisian landmarks to pressure the government not to support a European Union free-trade deal with South American nations.
title: French Farmers Roll Tractors to Paris to Protest Free-Trade Deal

author: Omar Tamo
description: Lebanon said it concluded a plan to demilitarize the south of the country, where Hezbollah had built massive infrastructure to target Israel.
title: Lebanon Says Militias Now Disarmed in South, Potentially Easing Israel Tensions

author: Taonga Mitimingi, Matthew Hill
description: Zambia will seek a new deal with the International Monetary Fund as its existing program ends this month, Finance Minister Situmbeko Musokotwane said.
title: Zambia to Engage With IMF on New Program, Finance Minister Says

author: Fred Ojambo, Monique Vanek
description: Uganda’s main opposition leader called for a freeze on foreign funding for President Yoweri Museveni’s administration, saying international support is sustaining repression as the country approaches elections marked by security crackdowns and internet restrictions.
title: Pop-Star-Turned-Politician Bobi Wine Urges Uganda Aid Freeze Ahead of Vote

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, President Trump has demanded a more than 50-percent increase in the US military budget to $1.5 trillion and also threatened defense companies over their shareholder payouts.

Elsewhere, protests have erupted in Minneapolis, after an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer shot and killed a woman in a car during a confrontation. President Trump cast it as an act of self-defense, alleging the victim acted in a disorderly and obstructive way. The Mayor of Minneapolis has called on ICE to leave the city. 

Today's guests: Edward Sterck, Research Director at World Platinum Investment Council. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: ICE Minneapolis Shooting & Trump Demands More Defense Spending | Daybreak Europe 1/8/2026

author: Lucille Liu, Jing Li
description: China sought to reassure Japanese businesses that its latest export controls are narrowly targeted, saying that civilian use will remain unaffected by curbs intended to limit military applications.
title: China Vows Japan’s Civilian Trade ‘Not Affected’ by Latest Curbs

author: Irina Anghel
description: UK house prices fell in December, according to figures from a mortgage lender that suggested Labour’s tax-raising budget discouraged aspiring buyers.
title: UK House Prices Tumbled at the End of the Year, Halifax Says

author: Andrey Biryukov
description: A Saudi Arabia-led coalition claimed that the United Arab Emirates helped a separatist leader escape to Abu Dhabi after Yemen’s internationally-recognized governing body accused him of treason.
title: Saudi Arabia Claims UAE Helped Yemen Separatist Leader Flee

author: Grace Sihombing
description: Indonesia’s fiscal deficit hit the highest level in at least two decades, outside of the pandemic, approaching the legal cap of 3% of gross domestic product in President Prabowo Subianto’s first full year in power.
title: Indonesia Fiscal Deficit Soars to 2.9% of GDP, Near Legal Limit

description: US President Donald Trump’s administration said it would take control of as much as 50 million barrels of Venezuelan oil. The strategy thrusts the federal government into direct involvement in the international oil market and promises to reinvigorate flows of Venezuelan crude to American refineries after years of sanctions. Bloomberg’s Rosalind Mathieson reports.
title: US Strategy on Venezuelan Oil Takes Shape

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australia will establish a national Royal Commission into antisemitism, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Thursday, bowing to widespread pressure following the country’s worst terrorist attack left 15 dead at a Hanukkah celebration at Sydney’s Bondi Beach.
title: Australia Calls Royal Commission After Bondi Terror Attack

author: Anthony Capaccio, Siddharth Philip
description: In a head-spinning series of social media posts on Wednesday, President Donald Trump demanded a $500 billion increase in annual defense spending but threatened to cut out some of the companies poised to profit the most from the boost.
title: Trump Demands More Defense Spending But Threatens Biggest Contractors

author: Lucy White
description: UK trade growth is set to undershoot the global average over the next decade, according to a new report from Boston Consulting Group which laid bare the importance of the European Union to Britain’s efforts to support exporters.
title: UK Must Deepen Ties with EU to Avoid Slow Trade Growth, BCG Says

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan protested China’s deployment of a mobile drilling vessel in an area in the East China Sea known for gas reserves, as diplomatic tensions continue to escalate between Asia’s two largest economies.
title: Japan Protests China’s Gas Drilling in East China Sea

author: Alfred Cang, Heng Xie
description: Leading Chinese oil companies with interests in Venezuela have asked Beijing for guidance on how to protect their investments as Washington cranks up pressure on the Latin American country to increase its economic ties with the US.
title: China’s Top Oil Firms Turn to Beijing for Guidance on Venezuela

author: Robert Burnson
description: President Donald Trump is asking to be paid $6.2 million for legal costs by the district attorney’s office in Georgia that charged him with trying to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election.
title: Trump Seeks $6 Million for Legal Costs of Georgia Election Case

author: Ramsey Al-Rikabi
description: Singapore Senior Minister Lee Hsien Loong said the US use of military intervention in Venezuela is of great concern, especially for smaller countries.
title: Singapore Says US Move on Venezuela Concerns Small States

author: Joe Deaux
description: US officials are rushing to come up with options for business deals and other ways to step up links to Greenland, taken by surprise by President Donald Trump’s renewed demand to take over the island, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Trump Team Races to Come Up With Deals for His Greenland Vision

author: Jamie Tarabay, Jason Leopold
description: A House committee voted Wednesday to subpoena billionaire retail tycoon Les Wexner in its investigation of the late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
title: House Committee Votes to Subpoena Les Wexner in Epstein Probe

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Senator Jeanne Shaheen (D-NH) and Ivo Daalder, former US Ambassador to NATO, react to the Trump administration's idea to acquire Greenland. Ben Carson, White House Nutrition Advisor and former US Secretary of Housing & Urban Development, discusses President Trump's decision to take steps to ban institutional investors from buying single family homes. Rep. Nicole Malliotakis (R-NY) on what she expects to happen when the House votes on the ACA subsidies. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump's New Plan to Address Housing Affordability | Balance of Power: Late Edition 01/07/2026

author: Lydia Beyoud, Isis Almeida, Nicola M White
description: The White House is considering a bipartisan slate of nominations for the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, according to people familiar with the matter, in what would be the first Democratic picks for a major Wall Street regulator during the second Trump administration.
title: White House Weighs First Democratic Nominees for CFTC

author: Oscar Medina
description: Donald Trump spoke with one of his main antagonists and ideological foes in the Americas, Colombian leader Gustavo Petro, days after accusing him of being “sick” and a cocaine trafficker.
title: Trump Spoke With Colombian Leader He Insulted Days Ago

description: The American leader’s move to strongarm Venezuela threatens to open up new flashpoints between the US and China.
title: Trump Opens New Front Against China With Brazen Arrest of Maduro
